title: Evolutionary Roots of Social Anxiety
description: A 60-second lesson on Evolutionary Roots of Social Anxiety.

hook.text: For most of human history, being rejected by your group meant death. Your brain still remembers.

buildup.text: Early humans survived through cooperation. Social exclusion meant no food, no shelter, no protection.

twist.text: A bad speech won't kill you. But your nervous system doesn't know the difference between a crowd and a predator.

climax.text: Stage fright is an ancient survival instinct misfiring in a modern context. It's not weakness â€” it's wiring.

punchline.text: Your brain is still protecting you from the savanna.
